original: de rnams bu dang chung ma dang 'khor dang bcas pa @134a * //
analyzed: de rnams bu dang chung ma dang 'khor dang bcas pa @134a * //
translated: They are all accompanied by their sons, wives, and retinues.

original: ste ; kha dog dang lag pa dang phyag mtshan ni sgrub thabs gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ste ; kha dog dang lag pa dang phyag mtshan ni sgrub thabs gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang bar bya'o //
translated: Their colors, hands, and implements should be followed from other sādhanas.

original: de la phyi rol gyi khyams kyi shar gyi char rus gong 'jigs byed dang / kha tv'am ga dang ldan pa'i tshogs kyi srin po dang / tshogs kyi dbang phyug dang / dril bu'i rna ba can zhes bya ba mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i mdog can rnams bsam par bya'o //🔽de bzhin du byung du gtum mo'i dbang phyug dang / 'du na sa'i lha dang / rgan po'i dbang phyug dang / sil sgra sa 'jigs byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mdog can rnams so //
analyzed: de la phyi rol gyi khyams kyi shar gyi char rus gong 'jigs byed dang / kha tv'am ga dang ldan pa'i tshogs kyi srin po dang / tshogs kyi dbang phyug dang / dril bu'i rna ba can zhes bya ba mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa'i mdog can rnams bsam par bya'o // de bzhin du byung du gtum mo'i dbang phyug dang / 'du na sa'i lha dang / rgan po'i dbang phyug dang / sil sgra sa 'jigs byed ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mdog can rnams so //
translated: In the outer courtyard, in the east, one should imagine the heroes of the bone ornaments, the hero of the skull-staff, the hero of the assembly, the lord of the assembly, and the one called the hero with the bell-ear, all of the color of the dakinis, and so on.🔽In the south, the hero of the fierce rite, the hero of the assembly, the hero of the old woman, and the hero of the sound of the cymbals, all of the color of the kumbhandas, and so on.

original: lho ru ni gtum bu ra'i dbang phyug dang / sgra chen dang / mche ba gtsigs pa dang / gzhu 'dzin zhes bya ba kam po dzi ma la sogs pa'i mdog can rnams so //
analyzed: lho ru ni gtum bu ra'i dbang phyug dang / sgra chen dang / mche ba gtsigs pa dang / gzhu 'dzin zhes bya ba kam po dzi ma la sogs pa'i mdog can rnams so //
translated: In the west, the hero of the fierce rite, the hero of the assembly, the hero of the old woman, and the hero of the sound of the cymbals, all of the color of the rakshasas, and so on.🔽In the north, the hero of the fierce rite, the hero of the assembly, the hero of the old woman, and the hero of the sound of the cymbals, all of the color of the pretas, and so on.

original: de bzhin du nu ba tu ni 'dod pa drag po dang / gnas kyi dbang phyug dang / cad te'u 'dul ba dang / rnga'i sgras 'jigs byed ces bya ba 'jig byed ma la sogs pa'i mdog can rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du nu ba tu ni 'dod pa drag po dang / gnas kyi dbang phyug dang / cad te'u 'dul ba dang / rnga'i sgras 'jigs byed ces bya ba 'jig byed ma la sogs pa'i mdog can rnams so //
translated: Likewise, in the north, (there are) the fierce desire, the lord of the abode, the tamer of the caityas, and the one who frightens with the sound of the drum.

original: 'di rnams kyang lag pa bzhi pa kha tv'am thogs pa lha mo la khyud cing lag na rtse gsum thogs pa mig gsum pa stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can sbrul gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa thong pa'i phreng ba can rnams so //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyang lag pa bzhi pa kha tv'am thogs pa lha mo la khyud cing lag na rtse gsum thogs pa mig gsum pa stag gi pags pa'i sham thabs can sbrul gyi rgyan gyis brgyan pa thong pa'i phreng ba can rnams so //
translated: These (deities) also have four arms, hold a khaṭvāṅga, embrace a goddess, hold a trident in one hand, have three eyes, wear a tiger-skin skirt, are adorned with snake ornaments, and have garlands of heads.

original: de nas phyi rol gyi mu khyud kyis gzhi la 'byung po dang / sha za la sogs pa ca co'i sgra sgrogs pa rnams dang / de dag gi 'khor rnams kyang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas phyi rol gyi mu khyud kyis gzhi la 'byung po dang / sha za la sogs pa ca co'i sgra sgrogs pa rnams dang / de dag gi 'khor rnams kyang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the outer rim, one should see the bhūtas, piśācas, and so forth, who make clamorous sounds, and their retinues.

original: drag po la sogs pa dang / rus gong 'jigs byed la sogs pa rnams kyi chos kyi yi ge ni rang gi ming gi dang po'i yi ge de kho na yin no //
analyzed: drag po la sogs pa dang / rus gong 'jigs byed la sogs pa rnams kyi chos kyi yi ge ni rang gi ming gi dang po'i yi ge de kho na yin no //
translated: The dharmamāṇavakas of Rudra and so forth, and Aṭṭahāsa and so forth, have their own names as the first syllables.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te gung mo dang mdzub mo dag brkyang nas lcags kyu'i rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te gung mo dang mdzub mo dag brkyang nas lcags kyu'i rnam par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should form the two vajra fists, extend the middle fingers and index fingers, and join them in the form of hooks.

original: aom a'a karsha ya h'um phat ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams spyan drang ba'i sngags so //
analyzed: aom a'a karsha ya h'um phat ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lha rnams spyan drang ba'i sngags so //
translated: Oṃ ākarṣaya hūṃ phaṭ—this is the mantra for summoning the worldly gods.

original: aom yum sv'a h'a zhes bya ba dang / rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya ni dur khrod ma la sogs pa rnams kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang sngags so //
analyzed: aom yum sv'a h'a zhes bya ba dang / rtse gsum gyi phyag rgya ni dur khrod ma la sogs pa rnams kyi dam tshig gi phyag rgya dang sngags so //
translated: Oṃ yūṃ svāhā—this and the trident mudra are the pledge seal and mantra of Gaurī and so forth.

original: thal mo sbyar nas de nyid g-yas su phab ste gzung bar bya zhing /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas de nyid g-yas su phab ste gzung bar bya zhing /
translated: One should join the palms and lower them to the right, holding them there.

original: aom ghram sv'a h'a bya ba ni drag mo la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: aom ghram sv'a h'a bya ba ni drag mo la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Oṃ ghrīṃ svāhā—this is for Caṇḍī and so forth.

original: rdo rje thal mo bcings nas dbye bar bya zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje thal mo bcings nas dbye bar bya zhing /
translated: One should form the vajra palms and separate them.

original: aom ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni gtsigs ma la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: aom ku ru ku ru sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni gtsigs ma la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Oṃ kuru kuru svāhā—this is for Bhīmā and so forth.

original: lag pa g-yas @134b pa brkyang nas rgyab gnyis sbyar te sor mo rnams so sor bcings zhing /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas @134b pa brkyang nas rgyab gnyis sbyar te sor mo rnams so sor bcings zhing /
translated: One should extend the right hand, join the two backs together, and form the fingers into a fist.

original: aom be t'a l'i h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni mi bzad ma la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: aom be t'a l'i h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni mi bzad ma la sogs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Oṃ vetālī hūṃ svāhā is for Aṭṭahāsinī and so forth.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te dku dag tu gzung zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te dku dag tu gzung zhing /
translated: Form the two vajra fists and hold them at the hips.

original: aom h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni sgeg mo'i 'o //
analyzed: aom h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni sgeg mo'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ hūṃ svāhā is for Lāsya.

original: g-yon pa brkyang ste mthe bong dang srin lag sbyar nas g-yas pas gzung bar bya zhing /
analyzed: g-yon pa brkyang ste mthe bong dang srin lag sbyar nas g-yas pas gzung bar bya zhing /
translated: Extend the left [hand] and with the thumb and ring finger hold [the incense].

original: aom su pri ya gandhe h'um zhes bya ba ni dri ma'i 'o //
analyzed: aom su pri ya gandhe h'um zhes bya ba ni dri ma'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ suprīya gandhe hūṃ is for Gandhā.🔽With the dance of the vīṇā,

original: pi wang gi zlos gar dang / aom h'um ho sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni pi wang ma'i 'o //
analyzed: pi wang gi zlos gar dang / aom h'um ho sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni pi wang ma'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ hūṃ ho svāhā is for Vīṇā.

original: thal mo sbyar ba spyi bor gzhag nas /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba spyi bor gzhag nas /
translated: Place the palms together at the crown.

original: aom shr'i sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni me tog ma'i 'o //
analyzed: aom shr'i sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni me tog ma'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ śrī svāhā is for Puṣpā.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas mdzub mo bsgrengs te khar bskyod nas h'um h'um h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni glu ma'i 'o //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas mdzub mo bsgrengs te khar bskyod nas h'um h'um h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni glu ma'i 'o //
translated: Form the two vajra fists with the index fingers extended, shake them at the mouth, and say,🔽Oṃ hūṃ hūṃ hūṃ svāhā is for Gītā.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te lag pa bskyod pa'i tshigs su gzung zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings te lag pa bskyod pa'i tshigs su gzung zhing /
translated: Form the two vajra fists and hold the elbows.

original: aom ai sv'a h'a zhes pa ni bdug pa ma'i 'o //
analyzed: aom ai sv'a h'a zhes pa ni bdug pa ma'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ ī sva hā.

original: lag pa g-yon pas g-yas kyi rked pa'i char sgeg pa dang bcas par bzhag nas g-yas phrag par gzhag cing /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pas g-yas kyi rked pa'i char sgeg pa dang bcas par bzhag nas g-yas phrag par gzhag cing /
translated: With the left hand at the level of the right hip, holding a mirror, with a flirtatious gesture, and placing the right hand on the shoulder,🔽Oṃ su nī rte svā hā.

original: aom su ni rte sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni gar ma'i 'o //
analyzed: aom su ni rte sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni gar ma'i 'o //
translated: The mudra of the goddess of dance.

original: bral mo sbyar ba spyi bor gzung zhing /
analyzed: bral mo sbyar ba spyi bor gzung zhing /
translated: With the hands joined at the crown of the head,🔽Oṃ kṣuṃ svā hā.

original: aom kshum sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni mar me ma'i 'o //
analyzed: aom kshum sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni mar me ma'i 'o //
translated: The mudra of the goddess of the lamp.

original: g-yas pa khu tshur bcings nas mdzub mo dang gung mo dag bsgrengs te dpral bar reg par bya zhing /
analyzed: g-yas pa khu tshur bcings nas mdzub mo dang gung mo dag bsgrengs te dpral bar reg par bya zhing /
translated: With the right hand in a fist, the index and middle fingers extended, touching the forehead,🔽Oṃ mu mu hūṃ svā hā.

original: aom mu mu h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi'o //
analyzed: aom mu mu h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni brgya byin gyi'o //
translated: The mudra of Indra.

original: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis rin po che'i rnam par spyar zhing /
analyzed: rdo rje bsdams pa bcings nas mdzub mo gnyis rin po che'i rnam par spyar zhing /
translated: With the vajra-bond, the two index fingers crossed in the form of a jewel,🔽Oṃ ratne gre svā hā.

original: aom ratne gre sv'a h'um zhes bya ba ni nor spyin gyi'o //
analyzed: aom ratne gre sv'a h'um zhes bya ba ni nor spyin gyi'o //
translated: The mudra of Kubera.

original: g-yas pa rdo rje khu tshur bcings te sdigs mdzub bsgrengs nas /
analyzed: g-yas pa rdo rje khu tshur bcings te sdigs mdzub bsgrengs nas /
translated: With the right hand in a vajra fist, the threatening forefinger extended,

original: aom g'a ta ni h'um phat ces bya ba ni 'byung bo'i bdag po'i 'o //
analyzed: aom g'a ta ni h'um phat ces bya ba ni 'byung bo'i bdag po'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ gātanī hūṃ phaṭ is the mantra of the lord of bhūtas.

original: g-yas pa khu tshur bcings te /
analyzed: g-yas pa khu tshur bcings te /
translated: Form the right fist.

original: aom bhur bhu ba sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni klu'i bdag po'i 'o //
analyzed: aom bhur bhu ba sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni klu'i bdag po'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ bhūrbhūvaḥ svāhā is the mantra of the lord of the nāgas.

original: rdo rje khu tshur spyi bor bzhag cing /
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur spyi bor bzhag cing /
translated: Place the vajra fist on the crown.

original: aom kha sa sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug gi'o //
analyzed: aom kha sa sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni khyab 'jug gi'o //
translated: Oṃ khaṃ svāhā is the mantra of Viṣṇu.

original: g-yas pa'i ba dan gsum spyi bor bzhag nas /
analyzed: g-yas pa'i ba dan gsum spyi bor bzhag nas /
translated: Place the three banners of the right hand on the crown.

original: aom h'um sv'a zhes bya ba nu drag po'i 'o //
analyzed: aom h'um sv'a zhes bya ba nu drag po'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ hūṃ svāhā is the mantra of Rudra.

original: g-yas pa'i khu tshur snying gar bskyod cing ;
analyzed: g-yas pa'i khu tshur snying gar bskyod cing ;
translated: Shake the right fist at the heart.

original: aom sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'o //
analyzed: aom sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni tshangs pa'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ svāhā is the mantra of Brahmā.

original: lag pa g-yas pa brkyang ste kha sbubs nas g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyi khro bo'i sor mo brkyang ste dbus su sbyar zhing gdugs kyi rnam par byas nas /
analyzed: lag pa g-yas pa brkyang ste kha sbubs nas g-yon pa'i khu tshur gyi khro bo'i sor mo brkyang ste dbus su sbyar zhing gdugs kyi rnam par byas nas /
translated: Extend the right hand, turn it face down, and extend the angry finger of the left fist in the center, making it into the shape of an umbrella.

original: aom mu sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i 'o //
analyzed: aom mu sv'a h'a zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i 'o //
translated: Oṃ muḥ svāhā is the mantra of Indra.

original: drag po nag po la sogs pa rnams dang / rus gong @135a * //
analyzed: drag po nag po la sogs pa rnams dang / rus gong @135a * //
translated: The black Rudra, and so on, and the skeleton

original: 'jigs byed la sogs pa rnams kyi ni drag po'i dam tshig gi sngags dang phyag rgya kho na yin no //
analyzed: 'jigs byed la sogs pa rnams kyi ni drag po'i dam tshig gi sngags dang phyag rgya kho na yin no //
translated: For Bhairava and so forth, it is the fierce pledge mantra and mudra alone.

original: de la lha rnam par bkod pa'i rjes thogs la mchod pa rnam pa nyi shus yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: de la lha rnam par bkod pa'i rjes thogs la mchod pa rnam pa nyi shus yang dag par mchod de /
translated: Then, after the deities are arranged, one should make offerings with the twenty kinds of offerings.

original: sgeg mo'i phyag rgya bcings te yi ge h'um gi sgra brjod nas /
analyzed: sgeg mo'i phyag rgya bcings te yi ge h'um gi sgra brjod nas /
translated: Forming the mudra of the charming lady, one should utter the syllable hum.

original: h'um h'um h'um ghum tum h'um h'um h'um ;
analyzed: h'um h'um h'um ghum tum h'um h'um h'um ;
translated: Hum hum hum ghum tum hum hum hum.

original: aom ghe ghe ghe h'um /
analyzed: aom ghe ghe ghe h'um /
translated: Om ge ge ge hum.🔽Om getya getya hum svaha.

original: aom ghe tya ghe tya h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis shin tu mnyes par bya'o //
analyzed: aom ghe tya ghe tya h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i sngags 'dis shin tu mnyes par bya'o //
translated: With this mantra, one should please them.

original: de nas / rdo rje de nyid kyis bzung nas //
analyzed: de nas / rdo rje de nyid kyis bzung nas //
translated: Then, holding that vajra,

original: dril bu chos kyis dkrol bar bya //
analyzed: dril bu chos kyis dkrol bar bya //
translated: one should ring the Dharma bell.

original: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas //
analyzed: rdo rje khu tshur gnyis bcings nas //
translated: Forming the two vajra fists,

original: rgyab tu rgyab ni sbyar bar bya //
analyzed: rgyab tu rgyab ni sbyar bar bya //
translated: one should join the backs together.

original: mthe'u chung gnyis ni bcings byas nas //
analyzed: mthe'u chung gnyis ni bcings byas nas //
translated: Binding the two little fingers,

original: cung zad du ni bcing bar bya //
analyzed: cung zad du ni bcing bar bya //
translated: one should bind them slightly.

original: aom badzra gha nde ho //
analyzed: aom badzra gha nde ho //
translated: Om vajra ghande ho.

original: de nas aom badzra ghande /
analyzed: de nas aom badzra ghande /
translated: Then, Om vajra ghande.

original: ra na ra na /
analyzed: ra na ra na /
translated: Rara na ra na.

original: pra ra na pra ra na /
analyzed: pra ra na pra ra na /
translated: praṇā praṇā

original: sam pra ra na sam pra ra na /
analyzed: sam pra ra na sam pra ra na /
translated: saṃpraṇā saṃpraṇā

original: sarba buddhe kshe tra pra tsa ni te /🔽pra dzny'a p'a ra mi t'a n'am sambha be /🔽badzra hrid yam sa nto sha ni h'um h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis dril bu bzung ste /
analyzed: sarba buddhe kshe tra pra tsa ni te / pra dzny'a p'a ra mi t'a n'am sambha be / badzra hrid yam sa nto sha ni h'um h'um sv'a h'a zhes bya ba'i sngags kyis dril bu bzung ste /
translated: sarvabuddhakṣetra pracaṇite🔽prajñāpāramitānāṃ saṃbhave🔽vajrahrīdaṃ santoṣaṇi hūṃ hūṃ svāhā.

original: dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad kyis yang dag par bstod la rdo rje'i glu blangs te /
analyzed: dpal mchog dang po'i rgyud las gsungs pa'i mtshan brgya rtsa brgyad kyis yang dag par bstod la rdo rje'i glu blangs te /
translated: Having held the bell with this mantra, one should praise with the one hundred and eight names taught in the glorious Supreme Original Tantra, and sing the vajra song.

original: de bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bstod pa dang mchod pa byas la /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i bstod pa dang mchod pa byas la /
translated: Likewise, having made various praises and offerings,

original: yang dag par mnyes par bya ba'i phyir dril bu dkrol bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par mnyes par bya ba'i phyir dril bu dkrol bar bya'o //
translated: one should ring the bell in order to please.

original: de nas snying gar rdo rje thal mo bcings te snying gar gzhag la /
analyzed: de nas snying gar rdo rje thal mo bcings te snying gar gzhag la /
translated: Then, having formed the vajra-folded-hands at the heart and placed it at the heart,

original: aom shuddhe dha rme h'um a'a a'a aom aa zhes bya ba brjod pas lha'i nga rgyal brtan par byas la phyi rol gyi lha rnams la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: aom shuddhe dha rme h'um a'a a'a aom aa zhes bya ba brjod pas lha'i nga rgyal brtan par byas la phyi rol gyi lha rnams la gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: one should stabilize the divine pride by reciting oṃ śuddhe dharme hūṃ ā ā oṃ a. Then, one should offer the bali to the external deities.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i gos dang rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i gos dang rgyan gyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: Adorned with the clothing and ornaments as explained,

original: rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa /
analyzed: rdo rje dang dril bu thogs pa /
translated: holding the vajra and bell,

original: brgya byin la sogs pa'i 'khor dang ldan pa'i slob dpon rkang pa g-yas pa sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du gnas pa g-yon brkyang bas rol pa'i tshul du gnas pas rdzas dri zhim po rnams kyis dkyil 'khor grub bzhir byas la /
analyzed: brgya byin la sogs pa'i 'khor dang ldan pa'i slob dpon rkang pa g-yas pa sems dpa'i skyil mo krung du gnas pa g-yon brkyang bas rol pa'i tshul du gnas pas rdzas dri zhim po rnams kyis dkyil 'khor grub bzhir byas la /
translated: the master endowed with a retinue of Indra and so forth, standing in the hero's cross-legged posture with the right foot, and standing in the manner of dancing with the left foot extended, having made a four-cornered mandala with fragrant substances,

original: kha dog dkar po la sogs pa'i me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod de /
analyzed: kha dog dkar po la sogs pa'i me tog la sogs pas yang dag par mchod de /
translated: one should make offerings with flowers and so forth of white color and so forth.

original: 'bras s'a lu dri zhim po'i 'bras can zho dang kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar nag dag bsres pa zangs la sogs pa las byas pa'i snod rnams su gzhag pas shar gyi sgor gtor ma spyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras s'a lu dri zhim po'i 'bras can zho dang kha ra dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar nag dag bsres pa zangs la sogs pa las byas pa'i snod rnams su gzhag pas shar gyi sgor gtor ma spyin par bya'o //
translated: Having placed in vessels made of copper and so forth oblations mixed with the grain of fragrant rice, curd, sugar, honey, and black mustard oil, one should give the oblation at the eastern door.

original: 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i phyag rgya bcings la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i rgyal po'i phyag rgya bcings la /
translated: Forming the mudra of King of Desire,🔽one should recite:

original: aom batta le ma h'a batta li /
